Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Constructors
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    playn.core.Asserts
    Use stock java assert statement. These methods cannot be properly optimized away.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    playn.core.Asserts.check(boolean)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.check(boolean, Object)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.check(boolean, String, Object...)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkArgument(boolean)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkArgument(boolean, Object)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkArgument(boolean, String, Object...)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkElementIndex(int, int)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkElementIndex(int, int, String)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkNotNull(T)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkNotNull(T, Object)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkNotNull(T, String, Object...)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkPositionIndex(int, int)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkPositionIndex(int, int, String)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkPositionIndexes(int, int, int)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkState(boolean)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkState(boolean, Object)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.Asserts.checkState(boolean, String, Object...)
    Use stock java assert statement. This method cannot be properly optimized away.
    playn.core.GroupLayer.clear()
    Use GroupLayer.removeAll().
    playn.core.canvas.GroupLayerCanvas.clear()
    playn.core.gl.GroupLayerGL.clear()
    playn.core.Surface.setTransform(float, float, float, float, float, float)
    You almost certainly do not want to do this because this will wipe out any pre-configured HiDPI transform and break automatic handling of HiDPI screens. You should instead use Surface.transform(float, float, float, float, float, float), and possibly Surface.save() and Surface.restore() if you need to return to the "identity" (which is in quotes because the identity on a HiDPI screen will not be the the actual identity matrix).
    playn.core.canvas.CanvasSurface.setTransform(float, float, float, float, float, float)
    playn.core.TextFormat.withAlignment(TextFormat.Alignment)
    Use Graphics.layoutText(String,TextFormat,TextWrap) and render the wrapped lines individually (aligning them as desired).
    playn.core.TextFormat.withWrapping(float, TextFormat.Alignment)
    Use Graphics.layoutText(String,TextFormat,TextWrap) and render the wrapped lines individually.
    playn.core.TextFormat.withWrapWidth(float)
    Use Graphics.layoutText(String,TextFormat,TextWrap) and render the wrapped lines individually.
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    playn.core.TextFormat(Font, float, TextFormat.Alignment)
    Use TextFormat.TextFormat() and configuration methods.
    playn.core.TextFormat(Font, float, TextFormat.Alignment, boolean)
    wrapWidth and align are no longer supported.
